query.description: datetime e.g. YYYY-MM-DD / Returns any objects with updated data after this date
integers that correspond to department IDs e.g. 1 or 3|9|12, delimited with the | character / Returns any objects in a specific department
Search term e.g. sunflowers / Returns a listing of all Object IDs for objects that contain the search query within the object’s data

Boolean, true or false. Case sensitive. / Returns objects that match the query and are designated as highlights. Highlights are selected works of art from The Met Museum’s permanent collection representing different cultures and time periods.
Boolean, true or false. Case sensitive. / Returns objects that match the query, specifically searching against the title field for objects.
Boolean, true or false. Case sensitive. / Returns objects that match the query, specifically searching against the subject keyword tags field for objects.

Integer / Returns objects that are a part of a specific department. For a list of departments and department IDs, refer to our /department endpoint: https://collectionapi.metmuseum.org/public/collection/v1/departments
Boolean, true or false. Case Sensitive. / Returns objects that match the query, specifically searching against the artist name or culture field for objects.

String, with multiple values separated by the | operator. Case Sensitive. / Returns objects that match the query and are of the specified medium or object type. Examples include: "Ceramics", "Furniture", "Paintings", "Sculpture", "Textiles", etc.
Boolean, true or false. Case sensitive. / Returns objects that match the query and have images.

String, with multiple values separated by the | operator. Case Sensitive. / Returns objects that match the query and the specified geographic location. Examples include: "Europe", "France", "Paris", "China", "New York", etc.

Integer. You must use both dateBegin and dateEnd / Returns objects that match the query and fall between the dateBegin and dateEnd parameters. Examples include: dateBegin=1700&dateEnd=1800 for objects from 1700 A.D. to 1800 A.D., dateBegin=-100&dateEnd=100 for objects between 100 B.C. to 100 A.D.

Integer. You must use both dateBegin and dateEnd / Returns objects that match the query and fall between the dateBegin and dateEnd parameters. Examples include: dateBegin=1700&dateEnd=1800 for objects from 1700 A.D. to 1800 A.D., dateBegin=-100&dateEnd=100 for objects between 100 B.C. to 100 A.D.
